title: Twin primes code not working
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/644

With gfortran, Intel Fortran, and flang the code prints many twin primes. LFortran says there are none.

```
(base) /mnt/c/fortran/test$ lfortran --version
LFortran version: 0.14.0-1016-gd53a3b83
Platform: Linux
Default target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
(base) /mnt/c/fortran/test$ cat twinprimes.f90
! https://craftofcoding.wordpress.com/2022/01/17/translating-basic-to-fortran-twin-primes/
program twinPrime
implicit none
integer, parameter :: n = 1000
integer :: A(n), B(n), i, nprimes, d
real, parameter :: s = sqrt(real(n))
A = 0
nprimes = 0
do d = 2, n
   if (A(d) >= 0) then
      nprimes = nprimes + 1
      B(nprimes) = d
      if (d <= s) A(d:n:d) = -1
   end if
end do
write (*,*) "Twin primes"
do i = 2,nprimes
   if (B(i)-B(i-1) == 2) write (*,*) B(i-1), B(i)
end do
end program twinPrime
(base) /mnt/c/fortran/test$ lfortran twinprimes.f90
(base) /mnt/c/fortran/test$ ./a.out
Twin primes
(base) /mnt/c/fortran/test$ 
```
